The lighthouse is 3 meters in diameter at the base and 10 meters in x_height with white mortar covering the exterior wall. The building shows the early structure of Korean lighthouse architecture, which is a great value in terms of the nationâ€™s architectural history. The light signal blinks at 15-second intervals and can be seen from 37 kilometers away. From Dong Seoul Bus Terminal, take an intercity bus to Gangneung Bus Terminal.
From Gangneung Bus Terminal Bus Stop, take Bus No. 300, 301, 302, 315, 322, 323, 325, 326, or 328 and get off at Suhyup Intersection Bus Stop.

data.title: Jumunjin Lighthouse (ì£¼ë¬¸ì§„ ë“±ëŒ€)
data.description: Established on March 20, 1918, Jumunjin Lighthouse was the first lighthouse in the Gangwon region. The lighthouse is 3 meters in diameter at the base and 10 meters in x_height with white mortar covering the exterior wall. The building shows the early structure of Korean lighthouse architecture, which is a great value in terms of the nationâ€™s architectural history. The light signal blinks at 15-second intervals and can be seen from 37 kilometers away. The original lighthouse was destroyed during the Korean War but was rebuilt in 1951.
data.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Yanggu Punch Bowl Village (ì–‘êµ¬ í€ì¹˜ë³¼ë§ˆì„ (í€ì¹˜ë³¼))
dataList.description: Punch Bowl is a highland basin situated 400-500 meters above sea level in Yanggu-gun, Gangwon-do. The name comes from the basins resemblance to a large punch bowl. The village has around 1,700 residents, and is the only town that is located inside the Civilian Access Control Line. Along with the nearby Daeamsan Mountain, Punch Bowl was once a ferocious battlefield during the Korean War. Several monuments were erected in memory of the deceased souls. Since the war, civilian access has been limited, allowing the natural environment in the area to recover. Rare flora and fauna reside in the area, and on top of Daeamsan Mountain is Yongneup Swamp (Natural Monument No. 246), Koreas one and only high moor and time-honored treasure trove for the ecosystem.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Yanggu Eco-Botanical Garden (ì–‘êµ¬ìƒíƒœì‹ë¬¼ì›)
dataList.description:
First opened in June 2004, Yanggu Eco-Botanical Garden was built on a total area of 189,141 ã¡. Nearly 3.1 billion Korean won (approximately 3 million USD) was spent on the construction and it was built to be developed into a South and North Korean ecosystem restoration center. Located in the northernmost region of South Korea, it houses more than 400 rare plants including plants that are Korean native species and protected by Korean Ministry of Environment.

The garden is divided into six parts by their features including a botanical garden, natural forest, and facilities zone. In the botanical garden, rare plants such as northern native plants and alpine plants that are naturally grown in the demilitarized zone (DMZ) and Yanggu area are displayed in one place.

There are also walking trails, a medicinal plants exhibition hall, plant nursery, and greenhouse. To add a natural and lively touch to the garden, a mountain stream zone and wetlands zone were prepared to provide people with the chance to enjoy the pleasant sound of running water.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Wonju Sogeumsan Suspension Bridge (ì›ì£¼ ì†Œê¸ˆì‚° ì¶œë ë‹¤ë¦¬)
dataList.description: One of the main attractions of Wonju, Sogeumsan Suspension Bridge is the longest and largest pedestrian bridge in Korea with the length of 200 meters, x_height of 100 meters, and x_width of 1.5 meters. The thrill of walking midair is enough to make visitors come to this attraction. The skywalk next to the bridge offers an amazing view of the surroundings. With a protective deck at the entrance of the bridge, anyone who has the courage can walk on the bridge. Other attractions nearby include Wonju Railbike, Museum SAN, the Grave of Joeom, and more.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Wonju Sangwonsa Temple (ìƒì›ì‚¬(ì›ì£¼)
dataList.description:
Nestled at the edge of Chiaksan Mountainâ€™s (alt. 1,182 meters) Namdaebong Peak, Sangwonsa Temple was built on an area spanning over 330.59 square meters. Cool spring water gushes up through the crevice directly in front of the temple, and just before the crevice is a 40-meter high cliff at the end of which stand three rare specimens of cinnamon trees.

Although the exact time of its foundation is unknown, it is assumed to have been built during the Silla Period. Designated as Tangible Cultural Heritage, the temple has two pagodas standing in front of Daeungjeon Hall, displaying the typical style that was popular in the Unified Silla Period, and hinting at the flourishing Buddhist culture of that time. As the temple is located on high land, it commands a sweeping view of the southern part of Chiaksan Mountain.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Wonju Hanji Theme Park (ì›ì£¼í•œì§€í…Œë§ˆíŒŒí¬)
dataList.description: At Wonju Hanji Theme Park, visitors can learn everything about hanji (traditional Korean paper), including its origin and history, through exhibitions, education and activity programs. The museum consists of a two-story main building and an outdoor park. The buildings 1st floor has the Hanji History Room, Hanji Experience Room, an art shop, and a mini library, while the 2nd floor has two exhibition halls and a conference room.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Wonju Baegunsan National Recreational Forest (êµ­ë¦½ ë°±ìš´ì‚°ìì—°íœ´ì–‘ë¦¼ (ì›ì£¼))
dataList.description: The valley flowing from the top of Baegunsan Mountain to the north direction is called Yongsugol Valley. A dense forest, pristine waters and numerous rock formations in the vicinity all provide a beautiful scenery. The downstream area of the valley holds a large amount of water and it is a popular place for vacationers and visitors all year round.The forest park contains a wide variety of trees, some of which grow naturally while others have been more recently planted. In particular, the 1.7-kilometer section of the valley that stretches from the entrance to the resort area boasts breathtaking scenery and is lined with weigela and wild cherry trees. The park is carpeted with various wild flowers such as dicentra, columbine and hepatica, and wild animals such as water deer, wild boars, and raccoons are easily spotted.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Wondae-ri Birch Forest (ì›ëŒ€ë¦¬ ìì‘ë‚˜ë¬´ ìˆ² (ì†ì‚­ì´ëŠ” ìì‘ë‚˜ë¬´ ìˆ²))
dataList.description: From 1974 to 1995, Wondae-ri Birch Forest has been reforested with approxmiately 690,000 birch trees in an area of 138 hectares, with 25 hectares of land being used as childrens forest experience center. After signing in at the forest entrance, visitors can tour the forest by following the forest walking trail. The forest was designed to promote educational and environmental values and recognize the beauty unique to the birch forest.
dataList.author: korea-tour
